"Better Off Bread in Sydney exceeded my expectations! The Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich was a delight. The bread was fresh, the ham was tender, and the cheese was perfectly melted. The ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar was a mix of highs and lows. The vegetables were undercooked, adding an unwelcome crunch to the dish. Overall, the experience was far from satisfying, leaving much to be desired in terms of taste and texture.

The Mango Sticky Rice from the "Freezing Point" truck in Cape Town was a refreshing treat. The rice was sticky and sweet, with a generous amount of mango fruit. The mango flavor was well-balanced and not too overpowering. The portion size was generous and the price was reasonable. Overall, I would highly recommend this item to anyone looking for a sweet and refreshing treat in Cape Town.

"The Mac Shack in Cape Town is a game-changer! The Buffalo Mac & Cheese and Lobster Mac & Cheese were absolutely divine. The perfect blend of flavors, the creamy texture, and the generous portions left me completely satisfied. The bottled water was a refreshing complement to the meal. This is a must-visit for all Mac & Cheese lovers. The Mac Shack has set the bar high!"

The Cheeky Greek truck's gyros are a must-try for any foodie in Hamburg. I ordered the gyro plate and Greek salad, and both were flavorful and generous. The gyro was perfectly seasoned, with tender lamb, fresh vegetables, and tzatziki sauce that was tangy and creamy. The Greek salad was fresh and crunchy, with a perfect balance of vegetables, olives, and feta cheese. The iced tea was refreshing and sweet. Overall, I had a wonderful experience at Cheeky Greek, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a delicious Greek feast.

Gyro Plate, The King ComboThe "Cheeky Greek" truck's offering in Melbourne disappointed severely. Dry and flavorless gyros lacked the expected succulent tenderness. Stale and crumbly pita bread accompanied the dish, further detracting from the experience. The tzatziki sauce, billed as a highlight, was bland and watery. Friendly service and prompt delivery were the only redeeming qualities. Overall, the gyro experience fell short and wasn't worth the price.

The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad at Cheeky Greek in Melbourne were a delightful treat. The gyros were tender and flavorful, with the perfect amount of tzatziki sauce. The Greek salad was fresh and crisp, with a generous amount of vegetables. The overall meal was well-priced and satisfying. The service was friendly and prompt. The atmosphere was casual and inviting.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Sydney failed to deliver on its promise of authentic Ethiopian cuisine. The Lean Chicken Tibs were dry and overcooked, lacking the tender juiciness one would expect. The Lean Beef Tibs, on the other hand, were underwhelming in flavor, with a tough texture that made them difficult to enjoy. The bottled water and soda were the only satisfactory elements of the order. Overall, a disappointing experience that did not live up to my expectations.

Tasty Tibs' "Lean Chicken Tibs" in Sydney left much to be desired. The chicken, unfortunately, was dry and reminiscent of cardboard in texture, while the accompanying berbere sauce was excessively sweet and lacked true Ethiopian flavor. The injera, a typically fluffy and soft flatbread, was disappointingly limp and rubbery, failing to deliver the desired softness and chewiness. Regrettably, the overall meal proved to be unappetizing and fell short of the authentic and flavorful Ethiopian cuisine I have come to enjoy.

A delightful treat, the Sugar Cone from the Freezing Point truck in Seoul impressed with its smooth and flavorful ice cream. The cone, sweet and sticky, was generously filled. Adding to the experience, the presentation was festive and the service, friendly. All in all, it was a pleasant and satisfying experience.

"Crepe Suzette from Le Coin des Crêpes in Delhi left much to be desired. The batter, far from being smooth and silky, was dry and crumbly. The banana and chocolate filling was not only sparse but also lackluster. Overcooking led to a crispy outside and a chewy inside, far from the ideal texture. The overall flavor was disappointingly bland. For an authentic French crepe experience, I would suggest looking elsewhere."

The Mac Shack's "Standard Mac & Cheese" and "Lobster Mac & Cheese" failed to impress. The cheese was undercooked, resulting in a gooey mess, and the pasta was overcooked, making it mushy. The lobster was an afterthought, with only a few pieces and a weak sauce. The food was subpar and not worth the price.

A delightful treat was the Fish Burrito from Guac n' Roll in Sao Paulo. The fish exhibited freshness and flavor with an ideal blend of tenderness and crispiness. The tortilla demonstrated softness and flexibility. Toppings, including guacamole, salsa, and cilantro, were fresh and harmoniously enhanced the dish. The burrito was skillfully assembled, providing a satisfying experience and a unique, flavorful take on the conventional fish taco.

King Combo from The Cheeky Greek truck was a real treat. The gyros were perfectly seasoned, and the pita bread was fluffy and soft. The Greek salad was fresh and crisp, complemented by a tangy dressing that paired perfectly with the gyros. The selection of bottled soda was impressive, and the service was friendly and efficient. Overall, I highly recommend this dish to anyone in Melbourne looking for a satisfying and memorable meal.

Le Coin des Crêpes's menu presents an enchanting array of crepes and savory delights. A breakfast crepe, graced with light batter and a sweet topping, proved to be an excellent morning choice. The chicken pot pie crepe, boasting tender chicken and a flaky crust, emerged as a hearty and delectable entree. The crepe Suzette, a traditional favorite filled with fresh fruit and cream, offered a refreshing and indulgent dessert. The ice tea served as a revitalizing companion to the sweet and savory crepes. The time spent at Le Coin des Crêpes was enjoyable and fulfilling, offering a taste of French elegance in the midst of Montreal.

Disappointment was the main ingredient in my "The Original" grilled cheese from The Mega Melt in Madrid. The bread was over-toasted, leaving it dry and crumbly, while the cheese was barely melted. As for "Miss Piggie", the promised ham was scarcely there, making it more of a bland cheese sandwich than a delightful grilled cheese experience. The Mega Melt failed to deliver the grilled cheese goodness I was expecting.

Delightful treats were discovered at the Cheeky Greek truck, where gyros, Greek salad, and bottled soda graced the menu. A generous serving of tender lamb, fresh toppings, and fluffy pita bread made up the gyro plate. Accompanying this was a refreshing and flavorful Greek salad, bursting with crisp vegetables and dressed in a tangy sauce. Opting for the King Combo provided a satisfying and convenient meal, combining a gyro, Greek salad, and bottled soda. The food was not only flavorful and well-portioned, but the service was also friendly.

Disappointment was the flavor of the day at Le Coin des Crêpes. The Crepe Suzette lacked the promised zest, serving up a bland, forgettable experience. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe, a concept brimming with potential, fell flat due to an overly doughy crepe that overpowered the filling. Barcelona's crepe scene deserves better than this lackluster performance.

While the menu items such as the gyro plate and the king combo were flavorful, the overall experience was marred by poor service and an incorrect order. The ice tea was lukewarm, and the bottled water was not provided. Additionally, the Greek salad was missing key ingredients such as olives and red onions. The staff were unattentive and failed to address these issues despite repeated attempts to communicate. Given the high price and the lack of satisfactory service, it is not recommended to dine at this establishment.

The food at this restaurant was sadly subpar. The tacos were dry and unflavorful, and the burrito was overstuffed with cheap fillings. The veggie taco bowl was the most disappointing of all, with anemic, limp vegetables and a bland sauce. The service was also poor, with long wait times and an inattentive staff. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Unsatisfying experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. The ramen broth lacked depth and was overly watery. Noodles were unfortunately overcooked. Chicken in creamy chicken ramen was unappetizingly tough and chewy. Vegetables in spicy miso vegetable ramen were undercooked. Bottled sodas and ice teas were the meal's only redeeming qualities. I cannot endorse a visit to Kitakata Ramen Bar.

Disappointed with the Cheeky Greek experience in Mumbai. The Gyro Plate lacked authenticity, and the meat was dry and overcooked. The Greek Salad was uninspiring, with wilted lettuce and a dressing that was too tart. The menu claimed to be authentic, but the food failed to deliver on that promise. Not worth the price paid, and I wouldn't recommend it to others seeking genuine Greek cuisine.

Cheeky Greek truck in Mumbai provided a dining experience that was satisfactory. A standout was the Greek Salad, boasting freshness and a delightful blend of vegetables and feta cheese. The King Combo, a gyro and fries combo, proved to be both filling and flavorful, though a tad more seasoning on the gyro would have been appreciated. The Gyro Plate was ample in size, yet the pita bread was a bit dry. The bottled water was as expected. In summary, the meal was acceptable, but enhancements could be made in the areas of seasoning and bread quality.

The Veggie Combo at Tasty Tibs in Seoul was a flavorful and satisfying experience. The vegetables were fresh and crisp, and the berbere spice added a kick to the dish. The Peking Truck in Krakow is a hidden gem serving delicious Chinese cuisine! I was thrilled with my order, especially the Wonton Soup that had a perfect balance of flavors and the Combo Lo Mein that was cooked to perfection. The bottled water and ice tea were refreshing complements to the meal. The quality of food and service provided by this truck was top-notch, making my dining experience truly enjoyable. I highly recommend giving the Peking Truck a visit whenever you're in Krakow!

The Peking Truck in Krakow served up a decent Combo Lo Mein, a popular choice from their Chinese menu. The Mac Shack in Toronto served up a unique mac and cheese experience. I thoroughly enjoyed the delicious feast I ordered from "Cheeky Greek" in Toronto. The King Combo and Gyro Plate were perfectly seasoned, with tender gyros, fresh vegetables, and creamy tzatziki sauce. The Greek salad was refreshing and crisp, a perfect accompaniment to the gyro. The bottled water was refreshing and kept me hydrated throughout the meal. Overall, I had a wonderful dining experience and would highly recommend "Cheeky Greek" to anyone in the Toronto area.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Denver failed to impress. The Rack of Pork Ribs was overcooked, resulting in a dry and chewy texture. The Spring Mix Salad was wilted and lacking in freshness. The Three Meat Plate was disappointing with small portions and lackluster flavor. Even the Pulled Pork Sandwich, a staple in any BBQ menu, was underwhelming. The drinks, Bottled Soda, Ice Tea, and Bottled Water, were the only satisfactory items in the order. Overall, not a recommended choice for BBQ lovers in Denver.

"Vancouverites, réjouissez-vous! Not the Wurst Hot Dogs est arrivé en ville et offre une expérience de hot-dogs inoubliable. The "Revenge of the Curds" poutine at this London truck was absolutely a delight. The mothers favorite, the kitchen sink, was crispy on the outside and gooey on the inside, just the way I like it. The bottled soda was a refreshing accompaniment to the savory poutine. The overall experience was top-notch, and I'd highly recommend this truck to anyone in London.

Guac n' Roll truck's tacos serve a delightful, satisfying experience. Their lean burrito bowl and fish burrito are both expertly prepared, featuring fresh ingredients and lively flavors. The meat's tenderness and rich taste, complemented by toppings like guacamole, salsa, and sour cream, provide a hint of indulgence. The ample servings ensure you depart content and fulfilled. In summary, for those in search of a flavorful, fulfilling meal on the move, Guac n' Roll comes highly recommended.

A delightful and fulfilling experience was had with Peking Truck's combo fried rice. The rice exhibitioned flawless cooking, boasting an ample supply of vegetables and meat. The sauce presented a savory and enticing aroma, and the harmonious blend of flavors was commendable. Portions were plentiful, and the affordability of the price was noteworthy. I wholeheartedly endorse the combo fried rice from Peking Truck.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's New York and Chicago dogs failed to meet expectations. Hot dogs were dry and overcooked, with insufficient toppings. Stale buns and low-quality mustard further detracted from the experience. Disappointing overall, not recommended.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Berlin delivered a feast that truly satisfied my appetite. The Spring Mix Salad was fresh and crunchy, the rack of pork ribs was tender and flavorful, and the Three Meat Plate offered a generous selection of smoked meats. Each item was expertly prepared and presented, and the friendly staff were attentive to my needs. Overall, I couldn't fault the quality of food and service at Smoky BBQ.

Cheeky Greek's King Combo and Greek Salad in Berlin proved to be a delightful treat. The gyro meat was tender and boasted of rich flavors, complemented well by the fresh tomatoes, onions, and tzatziki sauce. The Greek salad was refreshing and crisp, with an abundant amount of fresh vegetables. The presentation and portion size were impressive, leaving us feeling satisfied. Although the price was a bit higher than what we're used to for gyros, we found the high-quality ingredients and exceptional dining experience to be worth every penny.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Berlin is an absolute delight! Their Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen are culinary masterpieces. The rich, flavorful broth in the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was perfectly balanced with the fresh, crunchy vegetables. The Tonkotsu Ramen, on the other hand, boasted a creamy, hearty broth that was pure comfort in a bowl. The noodles in both dishes were cooked to perfection. The service was prompt and the staff was friendly, making the dining experience even more enjoyable. This is a must-visit for all ramen lovers!

Disappointment was the main course at Peking Truck in Cape Town. The Combo Fried Rice was a bland, uninspiring mix, lacking the vibrant flavors one expects from Chinese cuisine. The Wonton Soup, while promising, was a letdown with tough, chewy wontons. The overall experience was underwhelming, failing to deliver the culinary adventure that a food truck should offer.

Better Off Bread truck offers a range of delicious sandwiches and thirst-quenching beverages. The Italian and Pastrami sandwiches stood out with their fresh ingredients and toasted bread, while the Hot Ham & Cheese sandwiches boasted melt-in-your-mouth cheese and tender ham. The bottled soda and iced tea were excellent accompaniments to the sandwiches, providing a refreshing contrast on a warm day. My experience at Better Off Bread was thoroughly enjoyable, and I highly recommend this food truck for anyone seeking a quick and satisfying meal in Cape Town.

This order was a complete disappointment. The ramen was bland and flavorless, not at all what I expected from a place called "Kitakata Ramen Bar." The chicken in the creamy chicken ramen was tough and rubbery, and the tonkotsu ramen was barely edible. The bottled water was the only redeeming factor. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

The Guac n' Roll taco bowl was a delightful treat. The generous portions of fresh, crispy vegetables, succulent tofu, and creamy guacamole were expertly combined with the tangy salsa and fresh cilantro. The taco bowl was flavorful, satisfying, and visually appealing. The ingredients were fresh and of high quality, and the overall presentation was impeccable. The staff were friendly and attentive, and the service was prompt. Overall, the Guac n' Roll taco bowl was an enjoyable and memorable dining experience.

The food at Tasty Tibs was an absolute disaster. The chicken was dry and overcooked, the veggie combo was limp and soggy, and the beef tibs were tough as nails.
